contentfulPagePressRelease.title: WORAL Signs MoU with Universiti Sains Islam Malaysia

childMarkdownRemark.html:
The World Organization for Renaissance of Arabic Language (WORAL) has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Universiti Sains Islam Malaysia (USIM) to establish an Arabic language section at USIM’s library.

The MoU aims to promote the use of Arabic in Malaysia and other Asian countries, and will see WORAL offer educational and cultural programs across Malaysia.
The document was co-signed by Dr. Abdulaziz Al-Subai'ei, Chair of the Board of Trustees of WORAL, and Dr. Musa Ahmad, Vice-Chancellor of USIM, in the presence of officials, academics and researchers who share a mutual interest in the promotion of Arabic language and Islamic culture.

Dr. Abdulaziz Al-Subai'ei said: "We are very happy to collaborate with USIM in order to promote Arabic language programs in Malaysia and other Asian countries. This agreement reflects the importance we attribute to building partnerships around the world, as well as building bridges for cultural interaction and support of the Arabic language.”
The MoU facilitates the improvement of Arabic language standards for teachers, equipping them with skills to teach non-Arabic speakers. It also attempts to enhance content on the internet, as well as promote the exchange of experimental research studies.

The World Organization for Renaissance of Arabic Language, a member of Qatar Foundation for Education, Science and Community Development (QF), was established in 2013. It aims to promote the Arabic language by implementing creative initiatives to highlight its stature as a language associated with research, science and culture.
